attributes.action: ensure all the British residents detained at Guantanamo, including Ahmed Errachiddi recently released to Morocco, are re-united with their families in Britain immediately.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
This weekend Ahmed Errachiddi was released from Guantanamo and sent to Morocco. As yet, his family and friends do not know his whereabouts and they are all concerned about his safety. 

Campaigners are concerned about the fate of all the British residents held at Guantanamo. We would like the Prime Minister to use his "special relationship" with United States and ensure the return of all the British residents held at Guantanamo to their families in Britain.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "ensure all the British residents detained at Guantanamo, including Ahmed Errachiddi recently released to Morocco, are re-united with their families in Britain immediately."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.pm.gov.uk/output/Page15717.asp

Prime Minister's Office
